name: Homewood Suites by Hilton Jacksonville Downtown/Southbank

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for a weekend of College Basketball March Madness March 19-March 22. As most of these reviews will agree, it is certainly a nice hotel. One issue is that it is not located in a good area, and it would be highly foolish to walk around these parts in the evening. Also, like one other review noted, if you are on the Kings Ave. side of the hotel, which is half of the hotel, you will be hearing loud music and trains until 2 AM for the music, and trains will be on and off throughout the day/night....I think the train is realistic to deal with, but the music is ridiculous. The fact that guests complain about it and the hotel has not struck an agreement to get them to turn it down a little bit is beyond me.Also, like some reviews stated earlier, there is a weird smell that if you are sensitive to that sorta thing, will bother you...Aside from the reasons to be kept up all night, it is a nice hotel, with a good breakfast every morning. Just be aware of the the distractions....
reviews.title: Nice Hotel with some unfortunate issues

reviews.text: I was scheduled to stay at this hotel from a Thursday to a Sunday. When I arrived I was pleased by the accomodations, however, when walking into the lobby I was overwhelmed by the strong stench of some type of seafood that had gone bad. I assumed that the smell would be limited to the lobby area. Unfortunately, when I got off of the elevator to go to my room, some other type of offensive odor was immediately noticable. To my dismay, the smell was also noticable in my room. I cannot describe the odor... but it was so pungent my cousin vomited about five minutes after we walked into the suite. I honestly cannot describe the smell, my cousin and I have tried to figure it out with no success. I can assure you that neither of us have a history of mental illness and do not suffer from olfactory hallucinations, and an earlier reviewer of this hotel mentioned it as well, so I don't think it was imagined it. The hotel staff was very nice and seemed surprisingly unfazed when we told them that we were going to check-out due to the malodorous accomodations. We were later told that a "team of people" had been sent to try to determine the origin of the odor, so I suppose they were trying to correct the situation, although I find it impossible to believe that other customers have not reported it. On the other hand, if that type of thing doesn't bother you, the hotel is aesthetically pleasing, and the staff was very accomodating.
reviews.title: NICE HOTEL.... HORRID SMELL

reviews.text: Kitrina Smith at the Homewood Suites really knows what customer service means. She is also a great person. Thank god for people with her God give personality. I would recommend this hotel with five thumbs up. She should be employee of the year.
reviews.title: Great Service

reviews.text: Me, me wife, and two young daughters (ages 3 and 1) stayed at this hotel from Nov. 25-29. The hotel is brand new so it's in excellent condition. The lobby is warm & inviting and the the one bedroom suite was spacious, clean and well kept. The hotel is not located in the heart of downtown, but is not very far from it.
reviews.title: Nice place, with some issues

reviews.text: There were a few downsides as well. When you enter the hotel there is a foul smell and numerous guests picked up on it. You could also smell it on the elevators and in some of the hallways. The front desk people of the hotel all claimed not to notice it, which I found hard to believe. Also, the hotel is located right next to some train tracks with CSX trains going by regularly. So if you are a light sleeper, please keep this in mind. And lastly if you are on the Kings Ave. side of the hotel, there is a bar across the street that has live bands that play very loud music on the weekends until about 2 am. It got so loud that we had request a move to a the room across the hall for the rest of our stay. I will say the the front desk staff will go out of their way to accomodate any requests you have, especially Mark who was awesome in every way. And lastly, the breakfast each of our four mornings was just o.k. but I have had better at other Homewood Suites.
reviews.title: Highly Recommend

reviews.text: I had to check out of this hotel after one day. Let me be fair, hotel room wise this is definitely one of the nicer Homewood suites I've stayed at. New, clean, well appointed. The problem here is location. This hotel is on the outskirts of downtown in a semi business section. That's all you get here. When I asked the front desk where I could go to get something to eat on a Saturday afternoon I was given strictly driving info. When i asked where I could walk to I was met mostly with a shrug. Staying at downtown hotels can be a lot of fun like in Boston, New York, even Cleveland and others cities. But at this hotel there's nothing around it for a couple of miles and even then it's spotty.
reviews.title: A review from your extended stay business traveler

reviews.text: For breakfast Sunday morning our choices were pre-made breakfast sandwiches, french toast sticks, non fat milk, dry cereal, and yogurt. that might sound decent but not up to the Homewood suites standards I'm used to and a disappointment considering some of the stellar reviews this property has received.
reviews.title: excellent property

reviews.text: Like most hotels it seems in Jacksonville their "high speed" internet service was too slow for the amount of staying users. I had to tether with my cell phone.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To add to some prior reviews. The train sounds never bothered me. But I did hear some booming bass late at night from a nearby club. But neither bothered my sleep and I am a light sleeper.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay

reviews.text: Oh well time to check out and head back to the suburbs,
reviews.title: Don't Stay Here if You Wish to Sleep

reviews.text: From the moment that we arrived we were treated like royalty by the staff. The rooms was amazing. It was very clean and a great value for the price. We stayed for two nights and actually wanted to stay longer. This is where we will be staying when we are in Jacksonville, The entire staff was so helpful and so friendly. I really can't say enough about how much we enjoyed our visit.
reviews.title: CAN'T WAIT TO STAY THERE AGAIN!!!!!

reviews.text: On my last trip to Jacksonville, FL, I stayed at this particular hotel vs staying at my usual Crowne Plaza and I am pleased to report that it was an excellent decision!
reviews.title: Great Experience and New Hotel too!

reviews.text: This hotel is newly built and ajoins the Hilton Garden Inn. This is a first and I had not seen ajoining hotels in all of my travels. The hotel is new so it is extremely clean and quiet and the staff are very accommodating. Although I did not use the pool--it was gorgeous and was in the middle of the ajoining buildings. My room had a king sized bed with a studio type living room with what I assume was a fold out couch. The kitchen was full and was great if you are staying for a while. The bathroom had a very large walk in shower but no tub but it was great for me. If you walk thru the hallway on the first floor you will arrive at the Hilton Garden Inn which has a bar and restaurant.
reviews.title: Great Service - Great Homewood Suites

reviews.text: Now for the down side--there is a parking garage right next to the building and the staff led me to believe that this was the only parking--it was not and there was a fee. If you drive around the driveway to the very back of the hotels, there is some minimal parking and there are also a few slots on the side. Maybe it is safer in the garage? Don't know. Also, the hotel signage is small and is difficult to see from the road--I immediately saw the Hilton Garden Inn signage and passed on by not knowing that the Homewood ajoins the Hilton Garden.
reviews.title: Amazing Experience

aka: Homewood Suites By Hilton Jacksonville Downtown/Southbank Hotel
description: The uniquely designed Homewood Suites by Hilton Jacksonville Downtown/Southbank hotel is located in the trendy San Marco/Downtown area of Jacksonville, FL and only 20 minutes from the Jacksonville International Airport. The hotel is adjacent to the Jacksonville Skyway rapid transit system to facilitate your commute. The Homewood Suites by Hilton is the perfect temporary housing venue for either short or extended stays.
